explanations.A: This shape has the largest volume, which is 3 × 8/2 × 14 = 168. The cube has volume 125 and the cuboid has volume 160.
explanations.B: I think you may have picked the shape with the smallest volume. The question is asking for the shape with the largest volume...
explanations.C: To find the volume of a cuboid: length x height x width. I think you may have multiplied by the height twice.
explanations.D: A cube has sides with all the same length. To find the volume of a cube or a cuboid: length x height x width. To find the volume of the triangular prism, work out the area of the triangular face & multiply it by the length of the shape. With these helpful hints, can you work out which has the largest volume of the 3 shapes?

explanations.A: To find the volume of the triangular prism: work out the area of the triangular face & multiply it by the length of the shape. To find the area of the triangular face multiply the base by the perpendicular height then divide your answer by 2.
explanations.B: This cube has volume 6³ = 216, whereas A has volume 192 and C has volume 120.
